It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its delicate, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is often found growing in moist, well-drained soils within dense forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
